docs.summary: Event that is fired when the keyboard is pressed.
description: A `KeyboardEvent` event occurs when the user presses a key while the cursor
The event is true when the specified key is pressed while the cursor is located inside the
the elements above. If another key is pressed while the cursor is located inside the
elements above, the event is false.

docs.summary:
Indicates if the Option key on a Mac or Alt key on a PC was pressed.

The event is true if the key is pressed while the cursor is located inside a [`TextInput`]($w.TextInput.html) or [`TextBox`]($w.TextBox.html).

examples.title: Get all of the keyboard event's properties
body: let value = event.target.value;       // string value of text inside "#myElement" before the last KeyPress event

extra.description:
This example gets the properties of a keyboard event fired when the
 `Shift` and `a` keys were pressed.

docs.summary:
Indicates if the Control (Ctrl) key was pressed.

The event is true if the key is pressed while the cursor is located inside a [`TextInput`]($w.TextInput.html) or [`TextBox`]($w.TextBox.html).

examples.title: Get all of the keyboard event's properties
body: let value = event.target.value;       // string value of text inside "#myElement" before the last KeyPress event

extra.description:
This example gets the properties of a keyboard event fired when the
 `Shift` and `a` keys were pressed.

docs.summary: Gets a string representation of the key that was pressed while the cursor was located inside a [`TextInput`]($w.TextInput.html) or [`TextBox`]($w.TextBox.html).
description: For keys representing a printable character, the `key` property gets a
Unicode character string containing the printable representation of the
key that was pressed. This does not necessarily correspond to what is
printed on the physical key since the user could have changed the keyboard
For keys that have no printable representation, a string indicating the
key's purpose is returned. Some examples are:

examples.title: Get all of the keyboard event's properties
body: let value = event.target.value;       // string value of text inside "#myElement" before the last KeyPress event

extra.description:
This example get the properties of a keyboard event fired when the
 `Shift` and `a` keys were pressed.

docs.summary:
Indicates if the ⌘ Command key on a Mac or ⊞ Windows key on a PC was pressed.
 
The event is true if the key is pressed while the cursor is located inside a [`TextInput`]($w.TextInput.html) or [`TextBox`]($w.TextBox.html).

examples.title: Get all of the keyboard event's properties
body: let value = event.target.value;       // string value of text inside "#myElement" before the last KeyPress event

extra.description:
This example gets the properties of a keyboard event fired when the
 `Shift` and `a` keys were pressed.

docs.summary:
Indicates if the Shift key was pressed.

The event is true if the key is pressed while the cursor is located inside a [`TextInput`]($w.TextInput.html) or [`TextBox`]($w.TextBox.html).

examples.title: Get all of the keyboard event's properties
body: let value = event.target.value;       // string value of text inside "#myElement" before the last KeyPress event

extra.description:
This example gets the properties of a keyboard event fired when the
 `Shift` and `a` keys were pressed.
